column1: The '''Celos''' was a lesser river or stream that flowed out of the [[White Mountains]] into the [[Gondorians
column2: Gondorian]] land of [[Lebennin]], a little to the west of [[Minas Tirith]]. It was a tributary of the larger River [[Sirith]].

column1: :The river Celos was located between Lower [[Lebennin]] in the region of Central [[Gondor]] and Upper Lebennin in the region of Eastern Gondor. The river [[Sirith]] joined it to the east, below the [[Warning beacons of Gondor
column2: beacon]] of "Sirthanc". The village of "Erynos" stood across from the mouth of the Sirith, on the western bank of the juncture. South of the meeting of the rivers the combined river flowed south through the city of [[Pelargir]] and into the [[Anduin]]. The Celos was the domain of the lighthearted River-maid "Silverfroth", one of the Five Sisters, though she and her sisters were widely considered a myth by the time of the [[War of the Ring]].
